intro: Dipcadi readii, commonly known as the Redhead lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking red and orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its bulbs are perennial, and it produces showy inflorescences that bloom in late summer. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
